title: Biden Braces NATO for Long Conflict With Russia, Making Cold War Parallel
description: Concluding a NATO summit focused on the war in Ukraine and other fast-changing challenges, President Biden vowed that the alliance would oppose Russian aggression for as long as needed.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Biden Vows Not to “Waver” After NATO Summit
description: Also, Chinese hackers hit the State Department, ocean temperatures rise and Milan Kundera dies.

title: Vandal Burns Major Public Artwork by One of Italy’s Top Living Artists
description: A man was detained in connection with the destruction of a monumental version of ‘Venus of the Rags’ by Michelangelo Pistoletto. City officials pledged the installation will rise again.

title: Despite Successes at NATO Summit, Divisions Remain
description: The alliance added Sweden, laid out new ambitions for itself and offered long-term support for Ukraine, promising membership someday. But Kyiv wanted more.

title: Racism and Sexism Underlie Higher Maternal Death Rates for Black Women, U.N. Says
description: Black women in Latin America, the Caribbean and the United States are more likely than their white counterparts to report denial of medication or physical and verbal abuse in health care settings.

title: Man Burns NATO Papers in Sweden in Protest Over Alliance Bid
description: The protest came as Turkey agreed to clear the way for Sweden to join the alliance and after the burning of a Quran in Stockholm.

title: Mahmoud Abbas Visits Jenin Refugee Camp After Israeli Raid
description: In the city of Jenin, partly dominated by militias, Mahmoud Abbas, the Palestinian Authority president, was seen as a relic and treated as a guest, not a ruler.

title: E.P.A. Proposes Tighter Limits on Lead Dust in Homes and Child Care Facilities
description: Under the proposed rules, any amount of lead dust in floors and window sills would qualify as “hazardous” and require abatement.

title: Huw Edwards Identified as Anchor Suspended by the BBC
description: The wife of Huw Edwards, one of the BBC’s most prominent figures, said in a statement that her husband suffered from mental health issues. The police said there was no evidence of a crime.

title: China Targeted State Department Emails in Microsoft Hack, U.S. Officials Say
description: Microsoft said the hack began in May and was discovered just before Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken’s trip to Beijing in June.

title: Erdogan Says Yes, but Not So Fast, to Sweden’s NATO Bid
description: After voicing his support for Sweden joining NATO, President Erdogan of Turkey said Sweden needed to take more steps to win the support of his country’s parliament, which he said will not take up the matter until October.

title: The Once and Future Climate Emergency
description: Heavy rains have caused catastrophic flooding and soaring temperatures are heating up oceans and cities. But emergency response often seems more popular than prevention on many issues.

title: What’s Next for Israel’s Judicial Overhaul and Netanyahu?
description: Critics of the government’s plan to limit the power of courts are wary of what they call “salami tactics,” slicing up the project into smaller pieces to make it more palatable to a skeptical public.

title: Missing Russian General Sergei Surovikin Is ‘Taking a Rest’, Lawmaker Says
description: Gen. Sergei Surovikin, the commander of the Russian Aerospace Forces, has not been seen in public since a short-lived mutiny of mercenaries on June 24.

title: After a Bitter Fight, European Lawmakers Pass a Bill to Repair Nature
description: The measure would require E.U. countries to restore damaged natural habitats.

title: Johannesburg Sees First Snowfall in Over a Decade
description: A light dusting of snow coated many parts of Johannesburg on Monday, driving children and adults to nearby parks and playgrounds.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Zelensky Praises NATO Before Meeting With Biden
description: The Ukrainian president said he was grateful for military support, seeking to move past a dispute over when his country would be invited to join NATO. He was scheduled to meet with President Biden later on Wednesday.

title: Biden Promised to Do ‘Whatever It Takes’ for Evan Gershkovich’s Return, His Parents Said
description: The parents of Evan Gershkovich, the American reporter jailed in Russia, said in a broadcast interview that President Biden had promised to do “whatever it takes” to secure his release.

title: A Turning Point for Military Spending
description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has led to a new willingness for countries to pay for their own defense.

title: Milan Kundera, Czech Literary Star, Dies at 94
description: Mr. Kundera, the author of “The Unbearable Lightness of Being,” was known for sexually charged novels that captured the suffocating absurdity of life in his native Czechoslovakia.

title: Mozambican Accused in $2 Billion ‘Tuna’ Scandal Is Extradited to New York
description: Manuel Chang, the former finance minister of Mozambique, is at the center of a scandal that roped in American investors.

title: How Ecuador Became a Gold Rush Country for Drug Cartels
description: In Ecuador, an intelligence official said: “People consume abroad, but they don’t understand the consequences that take place here.”

title: On the Front Line of a War Over Bullfighting Traditions
description: Opponents of Spain’s comic shows at bullfights by people with dwarfism say they are banned by a new law. But performers say the show must go on.

title: Florida Ocean Temperatures Are in the 90s Fahrenheit, Posing Risk to Coral
description: Researchers are recording ocean temperatures that pose severe risks to coral reefs and other marine life.

title: What NATO Said About Ukraine: Key Commitments
description: Ukraine’s president wanted firmer commitments about when his country could join, but NATO’s 31 members did make some new pledges to draw Kyiv closer to the alliance.

title: Chinese Hackers Gained Access to Government Email Accounts, Microsoft Says
description: The hack, by a Chinese group that the company said was intent on conducting espionage, went undetected for a month.
